channel.title: 3 more Qs to go
channel.description:
[size=15pt]A few questions for advanced coders...[/size]
1: Attacking Error l) OK, when I use a melee weapon and attack a player, it hits them. Then when they walk away, my character doesn't follow them and they still get damaged. My character doesn't move, and still they get damaged even if they are far away. Does anyone know how to solve this?
ll) [b]Sometimes[/b] when I click to attack somebody, it does the hitting emote but the other player doesn't get hit at all. I have to wait a few seconds then click on them again for it to attack properly. Why is this?
2: Anti-lag OK, I'm 90% sure that there is some kind of code that stops lag. Whenever I click really fast on training objects in my server, it lags. When I try to click somewhere else, my character continues to train on the object and doesn't move to where I wanted to move to. I have to wait like ages before it moves. I've tested many sources, and some of them doesn't lag, some does. The problem is... the training cases from those non-laggy servers are exactly the same as the one in my source I'm using... On my original source, I have actionTimer in those cases already, but it still lags. Can somebody please tell me how to solve this lag?

item.title: 3 more Qs to go
item.dc:creator: @NexondotNet NexondotNet
item.description:
@NexondotNet wrote:

Does anyone else know how to solve these questions?

Read full topic

item.title: 3 more Qs to go
item.dc:creator: @dragonus18 dragonus18
item.description:
@dragonus18 wrote:

have a couple of npcs around the training area say “no massing or automatic ban” and stuff liek that and scare em straight and im sure it wont disconnect you for 1 masser just ban the massers that is all i can tell you

Read full topic

item.title: 3 more Qs to go
item.dc:creator: @w00tz0r_pwnz w00tz0r pwnz
item.description:
@w00tz0r_pwnz wrote:

I think also somehow you can edit the object timer that you are training on. So if you make it a larger number it takes longer to click again for more xp.

Read full topic

item.title: 3 more Qs to go
item.dc:creator: @NexondotNet NexondotNet
item.description:
@NexondotNet wrote:

Still even when they mass click, it will lag. I’ve been to those servers that lag when you mass click. I can’t even move in those servers and I d/c within 1 minute.

Read full topic

item.title: 3 more Qs to go
item.dc:creator: @dragonus18 dragonus18
item.description:
@dragonus18 wrote:

well most good ppl don’t mass click on other peoples servers and youll know who is mass clicking because they’ll be training faster then anyone else and to make it so its easy to see you should set an animation to the training that way it’ll do the animation each time they train so it’ll be easier to spot them

Read full topic

item.title: 3 more Qs to go
item.dc:creator: @NexondotNet NexondotNet
item.description:
@NexondotNet wrote:

dragonus18:

kick them and if they do it again ban them thats what every other server does to take care of it

No, how will I know who is mass clicking? And nearly everybody mass clicks. It lags them and the server. I’m trying to make it anti-lag when you do that. If everybody mass clicks, my server is going to be laggy. I don’t want that.

Read full topic

item.title: 3 more Qs to go
item.dc:creator: @w00tz0r_pwnz w00tz0r pwnz
item.description:
@w00tz0r_pwnz wrote:

I dont know where it is but i have seen a tutorial that if you mass you are kicked and sent to jail. If i find it i will give you the link for it.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @dragonus18 dragonus18
item.description:
@dragonus18 wrote:

kick them and if they do it again ban them thats what every other server does to take care of it

item.title: 3 more Qs to go
item.dc:creator: @NexondotNet NexondotNet
item.description:
@NexondotNet wrote:

dragonus18:

answer to question 2 yes there is a code to stop some lag but the lag you are creating is massing lag which is very bad and cannnot be stopped there is no way to stop mass lag but you cna prevent it by not clicking repeatedly and the reason it keeps doing what u clicked is because it has to finish for every time you clicked on the object so dont repeatedly click

This is my server… what if everybody mass clicks on my server to make it lag?

Read full topic

item.title: 3 more Qs to go
item.dc:creator: @dragonus18 dragonus18
item.description:
@dragonus18 wrote:

answer to question 2 yes there is a code to stop some lag but the lag you are creating is massing lag which is very bad and cannnot be stopped there is no way to stop mass lag but you cna prevent it by not clicking repeatedly and the reason it keeps doing what u clicked is because it has to finish for every time you clicked on the object so dont repeatedly click

Read full topic

item.title: 3 more Qs to go
item.dc:creator: @NexondotNet NexondotNet
item.description:
@NexondotNet wrote:

[size=15pt]A few questions for advanced coders…[/size]

1: Attacking Error
l) OK, when I use a melee weapon and attack a player, it hits them. Then when they walk away, my character doesn’t follow them and they still get damaged. My character doesn’t move, and still they get damaged even if they are far away. Does anyone know how to solve this?

ll) Sometimes when I click to attack somebody, it does the hitting emote but the other player doesn’t get hit at all. I have to wait a few seconds then click on them again for it to attack properly. Why is this?

2: Anti-lag
OK, I’m 90% sure that there is some kind of code that stops lag. Whenever I click really fast on training objects in my server, it lags. When I try to click somewhere else, my character continues to train on the object and doesn’t move to where I wanted to move to. I have to wait like ages before it moves. I’ve tested many sources, and some of them doesn’t lag, some does. The problem is… the training cases from those non-laggy servers are exactly the same as the one in my source I’m using… On my original source, I have actionTimer in those cases already, but it still lags. Can somebody please tell me how to solve this lag?
